elements.title: St. Martinus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when the new church of St. Martinus (pictured) in Hattersheim was built in 1915 with Jugendstil elements, the architect incorporated parts from the earlier church?

elements.title: Walter Nolen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Walter Nolen was ranked by ESPN and USA Today as the number-one player in the 2022 college football recruiting class?

elements.title: poor of ancient Rome (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the poor of ancient Rome were compared to dogs by the Roman writer Martial?

elements.title: For the Girls (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hayley Kiyoko aimed for a fully LGBT cast while casting the video for her song "For the Girls"?

elements.title: Abd al-Quddus al-Ansari (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Twins, a 1930 story by Abd al-Quddus al-Ansari, was called the first Saudi Arabian novel?

elements.title: Sweet Vengeance Mine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Sweet Vengeance Mine was owned and operated by Black miners during the California Gold Rush?

elements.title: Twenty (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that at the request of Regine Velasquez, her former manager Ronnie Henares directed the concert Twenty?

elements.title: Jack Michaels (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that ice hockey commentator Jack Michaels began his career announcing an ostrich race?
